alert.note: Alert for Calabasas and Agoura Hills; Central Ventura County Valleys; Eastern San Fernando Valley; Malibu Coast; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Ventura County Beaches; Ventura County Inland Coast; Western San Fernando Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued December 08 at 9:36AM PST until December 10 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: CORRECTED STALE HEADLINES AND DISCUSSION ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH TONIGHT OVER SANTA BARBARA COUNTY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING OVER MOST OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES... .Moderate to strong north to northeast winds combined with low relative humidities will elevate the risk for extreme fire behavior if a new fire starts. The winds and risk will be focused over Santa Barbara County later today and tonight Friday and Friday night, then shift to Los Angeles and Ventura Counties on Saturday and Sunday. The decision on whether or not to upgrade these watches to Red Flag Warnings will be made on Friday. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE COASTS AND VALLEYS OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES... * WINDS...Northeast winds 20 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph. Isolated gusts to 60 mph in the windiest areas. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimums 8 to 15 percent common. Very poor overnight recoveries of 12 to 25 percent. * IMPACTS...If fire ignition occurs, conditions may be favorable for extreme fire behavior which would threaten life and property.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are likely to occur in the coming days. Residents near wildland interfaces should prepare now on what to do if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information..
